sources.description: A monumental adventure set in the 16th century, based on the novel by Nikolai Gogol Cossack leader Taras Bulba ( Yul Brynner ) goes to war against his former Polish comrades. In the fight against the traitors, his son Andrei ( Tony Curtis ) falls in love with the beautiful Polish woman Natalia ( Christine Kaufmann ). Out of love for her, he even switches sides. The Oscar-nominated score by Franz Waxman is as brilliant as the battles filmed in Argentina.

metadata.Plot: A "Romeo and Juliet" story that takes place in the late 16 c. Ukraine. Taras has settled into comfortable farm life after years of adventures and swashbuckling with his cossack companions. Though not wealthy, he is able to send his son Andrii away to a Polish school. At this time the Poles are overlords of Ukraine and the origin of the cossacks is struggle of the Ukrainian serfs to free themselves and their land of Polish domination. Toward this end Taras hopes that his son will be educated in the ways of the enemy. Instead, Andrii falls in love with the daughter of a Polish nobleman, setting the stage for a clash between love, family honor, and a struggle for national identity.
metadata.Writer: Waldo Salt, Karl Tunberg, Nikolay Gogol
metadata.Actors: Tony Curtis, Yul Brynner, Christine Kaufmann
